elements.title: Bessie Anstice Baker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bessie Anstice Baker (pictured), a convert to Catholicism, was the first Australian woman to receive a Pro Ecclesia et Pontifice medal?

elements.title: Characteres generum plantarum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Characteres generum plantarum, a work about the botany of the second voyage of James Cook, contains an apology for only including 75 new genera?

elements.title: Tyler Gilbert (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tyler Gilbert threw a no-hitter in his first Major League Baseball start?

elements.title: Ramsåsa Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the medieval rood of Ramsåsa Church was discovered in the church attic at the beginning of the 20th century?

elements.title: Pioneers' Day (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rhodesians continued to raise the Union Jack to celebrate Pioneers' Day every 12 September, even after adopting a new flag, in order to honour the original pioneers?

elements.title: Suzanna Hext (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Suzanna Hext chose to compete in swimming rather than equestrian at the delayed 2020 Summer Paralympics?

elements.title: The Presidential Vote, 1896–1932 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as documented in The Presidential Vote, 1896–1932, fewer than a quarter of the United States' counties voted for the same party in every presidential election from 1896 to 1932?

elements.title: The Jealous Wife (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Ming-dynasty novella The Jealous Wife might have been written by the "Master of the Doctrine of Subduing Women"?
